definition: to write characters in simplified form/the simplified form of a character/to abbreviate (a word or expression)/to write in simple language
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)

sentences.english: The sentences in these books are simpler, which are suitable for senior high school students.
sentences.chinese: 因为简写本里的句子相对比较简单，适合高中生阅读。

sentences.english: A logogram is a reading of a cuneiform sign which represents a word in the spoken language.
sentences.chinese: 简写是一读一楔形标志，代表了语言文字。

sentences.english: The downside is the loss of a valuable shorthand.
sentences.chinese: 不好的地方则是丧失了一个有价值的简写形式。

sentences.english: We have also exploited a short-hand for the function literal. Previously we wrote it as follows.
sentences.chinese: 我们也在字面函数里利用一些简写。

sentences.english: The magnetization retained by rocks from previous magnetic fields, abbreviated NRM.
sentences.chinese: 由以前磁场中的岩石保留下来的磁性，简写为NRM。

sentences.english: Short for weblog, a blog is an unedited online journal.
sentences.chinese: 网络日志的简写，博客是未经检查的网上杂志。

sentences.english: See also the short-form method of assigning template vary.
sentences.chinese: 参见模板变量赋值简写方法。

sentences.english: In the following examples, the tilde character is shorthand for "the home directory of."
sentences.chinese: 在下面的例子中，波形符字符为“主目录的简写。”

sentences.english: Abbreviations of frequently used double-syllables are the major part of Chinese Braille abbreviation plan.
sentences.chinese: 双音节高频词是汉语盲文简写方案的主体。

sentences.english: The local press is particularly vulnerable to predigested news.
sentences.chinese: 当地报纸特别容易发表经过简写的新闻。
